content.html: "loyalty to a company is the fastest way to lower pay" - @DThompsonDev I started at $45k, and when my manager left I got a raise to $74k after I declined an offer from the CFO to move to SF for $69k. I now make 4x what I made when I started in the *next job*.
content.value:
"loyalty to a company is the fastest way to lower pay" - @DThompsonDev 

I started at $45k, and when my manager left I got a raise to $74k after I declined an offer from the CFO to move to SF for $69k.

I now make 4x what I made when I started in the *next job*.
